title: Definitions
context: ยง262-1 Definitions. As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;Airport&rdquo; means any area of land or water designed and set aside for the landing and taking-off of all aircraft and utilized or to be utilized in the interest of the public for such purposes; &ldquo;Airport hazard&rdquo; means any structure or tree which obstructs the air space required for the flight of aircraft in landing or taking-off at an airport, or any use of land which creates a dangerous condition, including the placement of strong lights which blind pilots during such operations; &ldquo;Airport hazard area&rdquo; means any area of land or water upon which an airport hazard might be established if not prevented as provided in this chapter; &ldquo;Airport protection&rdquo; means protection against an airport hazard; &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of transportation; &ldquo;Director&rdquo; means the director of transportation or the director&rsquo;s authorized representative; &ldquo;Person&rdquo; means any individual, partnership, corporation, unincorporated association, joint stock association, or any trustee, receiver, assignee, or other similar representative thereof; or the State or any of its political subdivisions, or agencies thereof; &ldquo;Structure&rdquo; means any object constructed or installed by humans, including, but without limitation, buildings, towers, smokestacks, chimneys, and overhead transmission lines; &ldquo;Tree&rdquo; means any object of natural growth. [L 1965, c 140, pt of ยง1; Supp, ยง17A-1; HRS ยง262-1; gen ch 1985, 1993] Revision Note Numeric designations deleted and definitions rearranged.
